headline: Chief Product and Growth Officer | Adviser | Speaker
summary:
Chief Product Officer with 10+ years of experience in product management of iOS, Android, web apps, and 13+ years in tech. I’ve launched mobile start-ups from the ground up, improved user experience metrics for the Chrome competitor with 20M MAU (Yandex.Browser), and led the product strategy of the biggest EdTech company in Eastern Europe (Skyeng).

Currently, I am the CPO at Social Links, a social media analytics company that helps businesses and individuals leverage the power of social data. I am responsible for the product vision, roadmap, and growth.

In Skyeng, my teams committed to continuous growth by boosting marketing and sales metrics on both sides of the marketplace, optimizing costs, and growing LTV. Along with growth teams, I led all product platforms in the company with tech, analytics, design, and research departments.

Work is my passion. I love to tackle challenging problems, go deep into the product details, and exceed the limits to achieve my goals. Good at hiring and making great self-sufficient teams.

recommendationHistory.caption: March 15, 2023, Omar managed Denis directly
recommendationHistory.description: Denis is an excellent product leader, partner, leader and team member! He possesses the perfect blend of business acumen, leadership skills and empathy! Simply put, everyone loves Denis from team members to colleagues! He is able to easily navigate and positively influence a company’s culture while driving operational excellence! Denis would be a great addition to any company’s management team.

recommendationHistory.caption: February 14, 2023, Natalia managed Denis directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Denis was one of the key leaders that made Skyeng stand out in the market, directly affecting its rapid growth in new clients and revenue through the years. I worked with him for several years both as with my direct subordinate and as with my colleague when he became Skyeng’s CPO, and it was always a pleasure to have him around and be able to count on him at challenging times. 

Denis started as Product Marketing Manager and became Head of Product of the Commercial Department in no time, gaining responsibility for the whole customer journey till the 1st paid lesson, being also in charge of commercial analytics, marketing tests, and sales process automation. Thanks to his efforts, we re-launched all the marketing products, significantly increased conversion rates, built complicated analytical infrastructure, and improved the visual representation of the brand.

Denis always hired great employees, brilliant and motivated, yet affordable for each given stage of the company's evolution. What is even more important, he created outstanding product culture in his teams, allowing his teammates to grow fast and become deeply professional. 

Denis is a rare example of a manager that is totally result-oriented, yet enormously empathic, winning people over and making everyone come to him for advice, mentorship, or just consolation. I believe he had a very strong impact on the company's culture, making it so friendly and so demanding at the same time.

I am sure that Denis' profound expertise and vision, his ability to switch from a helicopter view to hands-on tasks, together with his talent for people make him an outstanding specialist for any ambitious business.

recommendationHistory.caption: August 21, 2022, Anastasiia reported directly to Denis
recommendationHistory.description:
I worked with Denis on a new product launch and highly recommend him as a seasoned CPO. 

The goal was to find a market and a target segment for the product that had previously only been used internally by the company's teams. Also to determine how much time and funding it would take to launch its MVP and what are the possible risks. Having made this assessment, Denis realised that the risks and the amount of investment required were too significant. Therefore, the project was closed, and the team focused on more promising areas. 

It might not sound like a success story, however, I see Denis's merit in making decisions based on data and saving the company from possible (huge) losses. 

Denis set specific goals for the team, making it transparent to everyone what results are expected and what tasks are the most essential. The team worked in week-long agile sprints, maintaining focus and moving quickly toward a solution. 

Denis not only managed the process, but also did many of the tasks himself, drawing on expertise from various professional areas. For example, he created a landing page, launched an advertising campaign, and set up a sales funnel. He calculated the economics of the product and determined how long it would take us to cover our operating expenses. 

Although the work was challenging, I felt comfortable working with Denis. It was a time of drive and fun thanks to the way he communicates and leads the team. Denis gave a lot of freedom to determine which methods you want to use to accomplish a task, and didn’t compromise your ability to handle it. He was ready to support, discuss difficulties that arise and come up with a solution together. I would say that his leadership style was based on empathy and equality, which I appreciate at work.

recommendationHistory.caption: April 7, 2022, Aleksandra reported directly to Denis
recommendationHistory.description: Denis is a game changer for any business! Talented product owner, able to evolve, dusrupt as well as support and imrpove any proccess and/or team. Wonderful mentor, have inspired me and my team to grow and think out of the box all along. I was honored to work together and happy for the future team Denis will lead.

headline: Co-founder @ Hodla - Shopify for validators - that helps them get retail delegations in any chain from any wallet • Fundraising!
summary:
Building "Shopify for validators" to help them get retail delegations. 

We fix the problem that validator customer acquisition relies on 3rd-party wallets that don't guarantee user attribution - that means validators don't control their traffic. Moreover, many wallets have their own validators set by default (Phantom, Cosmostation) what leads to conflict of interest.

We fix this by unifying the staking experience on the frontend level by integrating wallets and native staking in top PoS chains. Our partner validators get their own "shopify page". Take a glimpse:
https://app.hodla.org/allnodes

Where we are now:
- Live on 16 chains, 7 validators onboard including top-5 validator Allnodes ($2.7B staked)
- 4x hack winner from Interchain Foundation, Akash, Archway & Comdex
- Negotiations with 50 more validators
- Currently participating in the NEAR Horizon Accelerator

headline: Chief Executive Officer

Through strategic thinking grounded in deep data analysis and the implementation of innovative solutions, we have consistently achieved 20% annual revenue growth while adapting to new challenges and strengthening the company’s position amid global changes.

My management philosophy is built on three core principles:
• Strategic Leadership: Leveraging a data-driven approach to make decisions that ensure sustainable, long-term growth.
• Agility in Changing Conditions: Successfully adapting business models to new economic realities while maintaining competitiveness and efficiency.
• Proactivity and Innovation: Introducing digital solutions and optimizing processes, enabling the company to remain resilient even in volatile environments.

I firmly believe that a dynamic market requires not only rapid adaptation but also the ability to anticipate trends. My mission is to build companies that not only meet expectations but set new industry standards.

headline: Team Lead & Senior Software Engineer – Yandex
summary:
Starting as a Java Software Engineer in June 2021, I played an instrumental role in refactoring Yandex.Market's backoffice services, aiding the project's transition from Oracle to PostgreSQL DBMS. My responsibilities further expanded from September 2021 to September 2022 in Moscow, where I was integral in developing backend systems for Yandex.Market's transportation logistics. I also notably contributed to the creation of a Warehouse Management System. Addressing emergency system issues, I provided pivotal support as an on-call engineer. Ascending to the role of Java Software Engineer & Technical Lead in October 2022, I undertook the management of several large-scale projects. These ranged from key integrations related to transportation logistics to pioneering process automations. Beyond project management, I led cross-functional teams, optimised communications, introduced innovative project tracking methodologies, participated actively in hiring, and delivered enlightening talks on software engineering productivity.

During my tenure at the Higher School of Economics, I served as a Machine Learning Teaching Assistant from July to December 2020 in Moscow. Here, I was responsible for grading machine learning assignments crafted in Python, conducting insightful oral exams, and imparting guidance on a plethora of data science tools and foundational concepts. Furthermore, from November to December 2019, I also contributed as a Teaching Assistant for the Introduction to Data Science course, specifically designed for non-tech students. My role was pivotal in assessing students' work on elementary machine learning concepts executed within spreadsheets. Additionally, I was entrusted with the duty of providing students with a robust grounding in data science essentials, with a keen emphasis on the practical application of MS Excel for data analysis. My academic journey culminated with a Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering from the Higher School of Economics in 2022.

headline: Product manager at Yandex Drive
summary:
I’m a product manager with 6+ years of experience developing and launching B2C and Internal products for web and mobile platforms. I have a strong background in product, project, team and people management. My goal is to create products that help users meet their needs. I'm an advocate for  Data-Driven and Lean approaches.

I started my professional career as an engineer at the Service Desk. That experience helped me understand users' needs. Due to my active processes optimization, I managed to achieve the leading position of the Moscow Technical Support Group in just six months. While serving as team leader, in addition to my mandatory responsibilities (such as optimizing processes and managing the team), I launched a support channel via a Telegram bot, a system for processing and resolving users’ requests, a system for profiling new employees and a support web portal.These projects initiated the “Helpy” support ecosystem which won the "Project of the Year" award from the Global CIO in 2023.

In spring 2020 I joined the Internal IT Solutions Development Department, where I successfully integrated a secure printing system, and linked back office work processes (legal documents’ drafting, office support operations, etc) into Microsoft 365. I also designed an OKR-based goal-setting process that improved efficiency and effectiveness for both the Service Desk and my departments.

For the past two years I’ve been working as a product manager at Yandex Drive, a carsharing company. During this period of time I’ve conducted 20+ experiments, resulting in a decrease in median registration time to 15 minutes, a rise in registration rate of more than 10% and CR from registration to first trip more than 20% as well as a 15% increase in profit from new users. 

Currently I’ve been actively updating our application in Yandex Go super-app , aiming to improve user experience, expand the service capabilities and attract new customers.

My superpower is team building as well as identifying and fixing bottlenecks. I am always eager to learn new skills, explore challenges and connect with like-minded professionals.

Join LinkedIn to share an experience.

recommendationHistory.caption: August 15, 2022, Ekaterina worked with Fedor on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: I have been closely working with Fedor for over a year on various projects at Yandex Delivery, where he was responsible for creating and implementing a B2B client touchpoint map, which included channels like: banners, emails, call center calls, robot calls, SMS etc. His projects gave him the ability to master both his products and project management skills, as well as reach a high level of analytical skills which included SQL, dashboard creation and data-driven decision making. Fedor demonstrated professional attitude in the projects he managed and always achieved the best quality of work. His strong will and nice personality inspires others, so as a colleague I always found support and enthusiasm to face a new project together. Based on my experience of work with Fedor, I am confident to recommend Fedor as an experienced professional.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 27, 2022, Oleg managed Fedor directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Together with Fedor, we worked for more than a year at Yandex, where Fedor was responsible for the SMB customers retention and development. During this time, he set up a lot of complex processes, designing them and implementing then.

Fedor assembled a touch map from scratch, decomposing the client's path into components, identifying the bottlenecks. In particular, the entire registration path was marked up, decomposed into data, and for each of the stages a set of touches were prepared to move client further down the funnel. Fedor used existing touch methods (email communications, phone calls), and also used new ones (robotic calls and communications in a mobile application). It is also important to note that a number of tools were invented by him - together with the product and developers team, according to the design and logic described by Fedor. This tool made it possible to flexibly customize communication messages to customers depending on their geography, industry, and life cycle stage. Together with the marketing and design team, Fedor worked on the communication wording, on the visual component.

As part of the work on customer touch, Fedor managed a team of 60 people. For the most important communications, such as customer launches and churn prevention, live calls were used. Fedor built a system for daily monitoring of team activity and performance, as well as the impact of each employee on business metrics. He has shown excellent organizational skills by educating, motivating and involving the team.

In tight cooperation with the product team, Fedor took part in the development of a commercial product for the SMB segment, participating in regular task prioritization, testing the viability of product hypotheses and organizing field research and cusdevs.

Fedor also independently prepared dashboards of employee activity, analytics of their effectiveness within a week and a month, and indicators of the impact on the company's business. Each touch was tied to an analytics of the client's behavior after, in comparison with the control group. As part of this work, Fedor showed his skills in working with data (SQL).

Thus, for all the time we worked together, Fedor proved to be an excellent and reliable, stress-resistant project manager, with excellent analytical skills. Regarding the soft skills - Fedor is very open, sociable and brought a lot to the spirit of our team.

headline: Sales Director at SCOPD LLC
summary:
At SCOPD, we're at the forefront of delivering comprehensive security solutions that not only meet but anticipate the needs of businesses worldwide. As the Sales Director, I play a key role in driving strategic growth and pushing the envelope on what our technologies can do.

What We Do:

Data Loss Prevention (DLP): I lead the charge in crafting state-of-the-art solutions to protect sensitive information from emerging threats.
Biometric Authentication and Physical Security: I'm passionate about enhancing security measures with advanced biometric systems that ensure both digital and physical fortifications are robust.
Time Tracking + HR Analytics: Optimizing workforce management through precise analytics is a focal point of my strategy, ensuring that productivity and efficiency are always aligned with business objectives.
Computer Monitoring: I guide our efforts in developing systems that monitor and ensure employee productivity and compliance, safeguarding corporate assets.
Image Watermarking: I oversee the implementation of sophisticated watermarking technologies to protect our clients' visual assets from unauthorized use.

My Philosophy:

Proactive security management is the cornerstone of my approach, equipping businesses with advanced tools to address risks before they escalate. Through comprehensive insider threat management and user behavior analytics, we help ensure that businesses remain secure and compliant.

Achievements and Future Outlook:

I have successfully led SCOPD’s expansion into new markets and played a pivotal role in developing partnerships that have significantly increased our global reach and revenue. As we move forward, I am focused on leveraging emerging technologies to keep SCOPD ahead in a fast-evolving industry.

Connect with Me:

I'm eager to discuss how our innovative solutions can protect and enhance your business operations. Let’s collaborate to create secure and efficient environments tailored to your needs.

headline: Launching Yango Ads in Latin America
Head of Marketing - Middle East & Africa at Yango | International Growth Expert | Marketing Advisor
summary:
I am Ilya, a marketing expert with 12 years of experience in international marketing, strategy, and communications.

Throughout my career, I have managed marketing in 27 countries across the Middle East, Africa, Latin America, CIS, Eastern Europe, the Baltics, Central Asia. I have led up to 7 marketing teams simultaneously, 16 direct reports, supervising a total of more than 40 functional employees.

Currently, as the Head of Marketing for Growth Markets at Yango, I am building the leading international ride-hailing service in Middle East, Africa, South Asia and Latin America. I am also working as a Marketing Consultant, helping startups unlock growth and improve ROMI.

Before joining Yango, I held executive marketing positions at Yandex (NDAQ: YNDX), the largest tech company in the CIS, for 4 years. These positions included Head of International Growth and Marketing at Yandex Food, Head of Brand and Operational Marketing at Yandex Go, and Head of Marketing in CIS markets at Yandex Go.

Prior to Yandex, I built my marketing career at Sanofi (NDAQ: SNY), one of the largest global healthcare companies. In 4 years I have grown from Marketing Trainee to acting Group Brand Manager.

recommendationHistory.description:
So, if you’re looking for someone who will sit quitely in the corner and tell you everything is “just fine” when it’s not, well, Artem is not your guy. However, if you need to get organised, get prioritised and get-it-done then Artem can help you get there.

Artem worked tirelessly to deliver Twinelab’s consumer service to a pilot release – exactly what was asked for.

Practically speaking Artem is structured, methodical and focused – he continually strives to get the right thing done in a straightforward, no-nonsense manner. Most importantly though, Artem is deeply passionate and very sincere. If he joins your cause he will really join.

My 3 favorite things about Artem; He engages in a cause totally, he wears his heart on his sleeve, and, he’s not afraid to take a risk.

3 fine qualities indeed.

He also knows lot about processes and tries to do his best to fulfill those.

recommendationHistory.caption: February 8, 2009, Przemek 🐘 worked with Artem on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
Artem belongs to this type of people who focus on quality of every aspect of their professional life. Artem cares, however, about how this quality is achieved, namely he encourages people to be creative and inventive not just to execute tasks they are given. This type of managers achieve the best results as they can build (not just drive) great developer, tester, writer, etc. Artem uses this great skill of giving pieces of wise advice but leaving the final decision the the performer - this way he ensures that the project he leads is under some reasonable level of control while everyone learns on his/her mistakes.

I wish I would work with Artem sometime in the future on the "real" software project - it, for sure, would be a challenging and exciting experience and I know I would learn how to be a great leader/manager from him.

It hope someday to be able to work together with him again.

headline: R&D Engineer @ BitKernel | ex-Yandex | 🇺🇸
location: San Francisco Bay, San Francisco Bay Area, United States of America
summary:
AI R&D Software Engineer with 12+ years of experience and entrepreneurial mindset, B.S. in Artificial Intelligence, focused on development of scalable Web-systems in the Cloud and AI-powered apps.

Alien of Extraordinary Ability and Achievements: U.S. Talent Visa Holder.

Featured in Forbes, TechTimes, VC, HighTech+, Kommersant, Devby.io, Mesto.co, CNews, Techstars about Silicon Valley, Tech, AI and Startups.

Developed 30+ apps including web-systems, messaging apps, chatbots, recommendation engines, web crawlers, news feed, social networks, content delivery and management platforms, data lakes, microservices for such great companies and startups as Yandex, Glovo, Verizon, Coca-Cola, Adidas, Whirlpool, WeetCode and some others.

At Yandex, the 3rd largest search engine worldwide after Google and Bing with 150M+ / daily visitors, led software engineering development in R&D department. Built Yandex.Keyboard (https://yandex.ru/project/searchapp/keyboard / https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/id1053139327) for iOS with cloud-powered back-end, ML features, in-build search and recommendation engines, 250k+ DAU and millions MAU. Successfully competed against Google / Microsoft with their $250M+ In Cash and unlimited resources for the similar app (https://techcrunch.com/2016/02/03/microsoft-confirms-swiftkey-acquisition-for-250m-in-cash/).

At Glovo, food delivery unicorn from Spain, led backend services development, serving 10M+ users from 25+ countries and 1.5k+ cities, 100k+ stores and restaurants, ~70k couriers with average ~10-15 min order delivery time and ~1M / day order assignment decisions.

At WeetCode, from 0 to 1 designed and developed scalable EdTech platform in the cloud just in 6 months.

Some highlights:
- Entrepreneurial engineer at heart. Passionate about technology and impact.
- Hands-on experience in the development for Web, Mobile, IoT, Robotics, Cloud and AI.
- Hands-on experience in Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services and bare metal servers.
- Experienced in design & development sophisticated systems as web full-stack solutions, data warehouses, data management platforms, social collaboration systems, distributed systems and CDNs.
- Mentor at Techstars accelerator and Women in Tech initiative.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 26, 2023, STANISLAV managed Mikhail directly
recommendationHistory.description:
During Mike Starov's tenure as CMO at Anytime Carsharing, his contributions were nothing short of exceptional.
Mike orchestrated our successful entry into new markets, including Thailand, Czech Republic, Belarus, and Kazakhstan, driving revenue growth of over 120%, even amidst the challenges posed by COVID-19.
Under his strategic guidance, we implemented a robust marketing automation platform, fine-tuned customer engagement through PUSH/E-mail chains, and achieved remarkable results. We became the #1 carsharing app in Belarus (earning a national award), #1 carsharing app in  the Czech Republic, and ranked among the top 25 apps in Kazakhstan (according to Forbes).
Mike's data-driven approach was pivotal. He not only developed and implemented a comprehensive set of product and marketing metrics but also introduced an effective attribution model. This allowed us to make informed decisions and optimize our strategies continuously and meet our customer acquisition cost.
His innovative experiments in price elasticity and dynamic pricing models significantly enhanced our competitive edge.
Mike's consistent efforts to maintain a feedback loop with ongoing NPS-tracking, conduct Brand Health Tracking research, and effectively cluster our customer base led to an impressive 80% increase in average ARPU.
Mike Starov is not just a CMO; he's a visionary leader who consistently delivers exceptional results. I wholeheartedly recommend Mike to any organization seeking a marketing trailblazer who combines strategy with tangible impact.

His data-driven insights, diverse marketing campaigns, and brand activations in 70 cities showcased his versatility. Mike also built and managed a team of over 30 marketing professionals while effectively handling a budget of over 20M USD. His strategic vision and unwavering commitment to excellence make Mike an outstanding marketing professional, and I highly recommend him for any future endeavors.

In 2012 I started to work in Yandex in advertising technologies. I developed behavioral segments for media advertising and digital marketing. I combined the roles of an analyst and a product manager. After, for some time I promoted high-tech advertising products and custom solutions built using machine learning. But working in the commercial department turned out to be not as interesting to me as working in the development department. But I am glad that I got a new experience not only in product management, but in sales management as well.
In 2013, I changed my job in order to be engaged in the development of technological advertising products again. I moved to the Mail.ru Group company, where I created a new data analytics department. In 2015, we began to create a new line of business based on the usage of data and artificial intelligence technologies. Then my experience in the commercial department helped me. I was engaged in client service to help customers to find the best usage of our technology. The next new line of business in my department was a research project. We developed application in social networks VK and Odnoklassniki for conducting online surveys. My experience in marketing research helped me with this. It was completely my idea. This project gave us not only the opportunity to conduct sociological and marketing research, but also to obtain a lot of new data for building machine learning models. For example, psychological segmentation of social network users has become very popular in advertising technologies, marketing and product analytics.
In 2020, I changed my job and headed the AdTech direction at Rambler Group, the largest online media. I got a CTO position. I led the full-stack development of high load advertising technologies and Big Data technologies, including the development of a media content recommendation system.
I am interested in everything related to user behavior. For example: developing predictive models based on their behavior, analyzing customer experience and improving it by implementing machine learning algorithms into the product. Despite the fact that I have been in management positions for a long time, I always had projects which I performed by myself as a programmer and data analyst. I am sure that I can start my career again and achieve success.

recommendationHistory.caption: December 14, 2022, Мария worked with Mikhail on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
Михаил — один из лучших специалистов в Data Science, которого я знаю. У нас была возможность сотрудничать во многих различных ситуациях, экспериментах, проектах, и, независимо от предмета разработки, мы всегда получали массу удовольствия от обсуждения. Я многому научилась, работая с Михаилом, и я не могу не отметить его управленческие, а также невероятные тренерские и исполнительские навыки. 
Михаил обладает сильными аналитическими способностями, нестандартным мышлением, способностью работать в режиме многозадачности и быстро осваивать новые инструменты. Воспринимает проблемы качества работы алгоритмов машинного обучения очень ответственно и всегда доходит до сути проблемы. Настоятельно рекомендую Михаила всем, кто понимает, что за машинным обучением и аналитикой на самом деле стоит прибыль и качество. Он всегда настаивает на самых высоких стандартах работы, является надежным командным игроком и экспертом в предметной области.
Михаил — один из тех выдающихся лидеров, которые фокусируются на потребностях клиентов и добиваются успеха во всех проектах, которыми он занимается. Он особенно хорошо понимает бизнес-перспективы новых уникальных аналитических продуктов для обработки данных. Его прямолинейный стиль, новаторский подход к решению проблем клиентов и сильная способность направлять клиентов к лучшим решениям для их бизнеса делают его важным активом для любой организации. Я бы снова поработала с Михаилом с большим удовольствием.

headline: ML Team Lead – VK
summary:
As a Machine Learning Team Lead, I am responsible for developing and delivering machine learning algorithms to production. My role combines the responsibilities of a team lead, tech lead and engineering manager, which allows me to develop both technical knowledge and team management skills.

Experience:
- 9 years of experience in practical machine learning and delivering ML products for business.
- 5 years of experience in team leading: I have successfully assembled and nurtured a team of ML-professionals, elevating them to middle and senior levels. This team is now capable of solving complex technological problems using ML and implementing ML solutions in a production environment. My responsibilities include recruitment, career development, mentoring and talent retention.
- 5+ years of experience in project management: I can work efficiently in cross-functional teams, organize and and drive projects to successful completion within the required time frames.

Some Achievements:
- Collaborating with VKontakte's applied research team, my team pioneered the development and implementation of Large Language Model (LLM) on our own pretrain. This LLM has been successfully applied across Mail.ru (Mail.ru e-mail service, Cloud, Notes, Calendar, and several internal products)

recommendationHistory.caption: October 12, 2015, Yan managed Andrei directly
recommendationHistory.description:
В мобильных приложениях нет золотой середины. Есть хорошие приложения, которые люди используют каждый день, и сотни тысяч плохих приложений, которые попадают на устройство по ошибке и удаляются.



Для простого человека (меня) эта разница почти неуловима. Они используют один и тот же язык программирования, одни библиотеки, одни и те же руководства по оформлению. Но у одних людей получается - и приложение является продолжением продукта под кончиками пальцев, а у других нет, и люди или пользуются ими вынужденно или удаляют.

Так же и мобильные разработчики - они или делают приложения первого типа или второго. Я не видел еще какой-то середины тут. На её месте просто пропасть.

Андрей Давыдов относится к первому типу. У него есть какой-то загадочный внутренний компас, как у Джека Воробья, который позволяет ему отличать зерна от плевел. Может быть это оттого, что на его старом айфоне установлены сотни приложений, экраны которых отсортированы по оттенкам пиктограмм, может быть от того, что он знает какая функция кем была впервые применена, какая "выстрелила", а какая - нет, и почему. Может быть просто следит за новостями, может быть у него есть просто друзья, которые дают ему информацию. Не знаю.

Но, работая с Андреем - чувствуешь, что строишь приложение первого типа. Такое как "Рокетбанк", как Hotel Tonight, как Aviasales, AirBnB, Swarm, Shazam, Flipboard. С уютным чатом и фотографиями из края в край, с функциональной анимацией, которая заставляет возвращаться снова и снова, с элементами сбалансированной геймификации.

Обычного ответственного, организованного и исполнительного  мобильного продукт-менеджера сейчас найти довольно просто, а человека который обладает внутренним компасом, чтобы сделать приложение, которое не стыдно оставить на своем телефоне, приложение в который сотни тысяч пользователей (и самых лучших твоих пользователей, самых лояльных) будут возвращаться каждый день - такого Джека Воробья найти сложно. А когда нашел - стоит держаться.

headline: Head of AI @ Sumsub | Fight AI with AI
summary:
I am the Head of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at Sumsub, a global KYC/AML/Antifraud company. My responsibilities include overseeing the development of technologies for preventing financial fraud, models for detecting deepfakes, and improving document intelligence.

I live in Berlin with my wife and two borzoi dogs, and I frequently visit Tel-Aviv.

Prior to my current position, I worked at Tinkoff, a leading fintech company, as a Director of AI. At Tinkoff, I was responsible for owning and driving Tinkoff's AI strategy, as well as establishing and managing the Tinkoff Center for AI technologies (which consisted of more than 300 people and 20+ teams). I quit and emigrated to Germany after the war started.

Before Tinkoff, I was the Head of Applied Research at VKontakte, the largest European social network. My team aimed at advancing ML algorithms as well as bringing the latest technologies to VK. I was also responsible for newsfeed ranking and led the development and deployment of VK speech recognition for voice messages (200M per day) and a set of technologies for reducing hate speech on the platform. During that time, we also released yttm (https://github.com/VKCOM/YouTokenToMe), the fastest text tokenizer.

In October 2019, I founded and led VK AI Research Lab @ Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology, a small lab focused on NLP research. Our work included making language models less toxic.

My background is in software engineering. I graduated from Saint Petersburg State Polytechnical University with an MS summa cum laude in Computer Science and spent more than 6 years working at Motorola across the globe. Specifically, I was part of the team that developed au-Box and HD-STB set-top boxes.

I speak English, Japanese, German and Russian.

In my spare time, I enjoy running, cycling, and cross-country skiing.

A leader with over 15 years of experience in building data platforms, experimentation frameworks, analytics, and machine learning systems. I help companies build systems from scratch, lead teams of over 100 people, and achieve significant improvements in key business metrics.

- Development of Surge Pricing at Citymobil

When it became necessary to enhance business efficiency, I developed a new surge pricing algo. As a result of implementing this algorithm, key metrics like Rides→GMV increased by over 10% in various cities.

Tasked with building a data platform from scratch, I formed and led a team of more than 100 people (ex-Facebook, ex-Amazon, ex-Yandex, etc). We created data and A/B platforms (>1200 users, > 5Pb data), and a core data analytics team that directly met the requirements of top management, leading to improved data quality and enhanced analytical capabilities for the company.

I built several teams from the ground up, including an Search engine team, etc. I developed and implemented hiring processes, competency matrices, and grading systems. These efforts resulted in more than a 15% improvement in the company's key business metric.

I would be delighted to join a company in the e-commerce, or any other industry where tech teams, data, and analytics can lead to a significant business impact.

- в бизнесе интересует масштаб, результат, изменения, и развитие.  Люблю мыслить подходами “к”, а не “от”. Ставлю задачи по целям и по результату
- умение слушать и слышать. Бизнес подход во всем и быть на стороне бизнеса в первую очередь, независимо от сложности решений. Ответственность за результат и риски

- опыт управление командами от 1 до 300 человек. Большой опыт найма менеджеров проектов/продукта и разного рода руководителей. Хорошее видение на сотрудников: их текущих возможностей, потенциала и рисков

headline: Product designer ✦ Hands-on design lead ✦ Mentor in UX/UI
location: San Francisco, California, United States of America
summary:
Hi! I’m Nikolai, a hands-on product design leader with over 10 years of experience creating intuitive, impactful UX/UI solutions. I specialize in designing for complex, data-driven interfaces, mobile apps, e-commerce platforms, and browser applications. I love rolling up my sleeves and working alongside teams to turn ideas into user experiences that not only look great but also deliver real results.

Over the years, I’ve had the chance to lead the redesign of some amazing projects at Mail.ru Group and Rambler, achieving real impact along the way:

📌 Media projects: Unified the design across multiple platforms, improving consistency and making users happier.
📌 Recommendation system Pulse: Modernized a personalized content feed that’s now seamlessly integrated with the company’s recommendation engine—boosting engagement in the process.
📌 Charity projects Dobro: Simplified donation flows and strengthened the brand, earning more user trust and increasing recurring donations.
📌 Rambler Search: Reimagined the search interface for millions of daily users, enhancing clarity and ease of use.

In all these projects, I worked in design systems that helped teams make it easier to deliver great designs without slowing anyone down.

My portfolio shows my knack for solving complex design problems, applying UX principles, and working closely with engineers, product managers, and stakeholders. I’m all about finding the sweet spot between user needs and business goals—and making it work beautifully.

Tools and skills I use:
• Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Blender, and AI tools
• UX/UI design and prototyping
• Team leadership and collaboration
• Scalable design systems
• Design thinking and problem-solving
• Working in agile environments

A bit more about me
When I’m not designing, I’m probably exploring new design trends, sharpening my skills at workshops, or following what’s happening in the UX/UI world. I’m also learning English at San Francisco City College, which is a fun challenge! Outside of work, I enjoy hiking, volunteering, and spending time with my dog Azul.

Let’s collaborate to create impactful design solutions that make a difference!

Her marketing management approach is now a standard of business curricula in Russia, and she herself is a lecturer in Economics and Management departments in Russian Universities.

When you have been exposed to as many marketing executives in the field as I have, you know talent instantly when you see it, and can easily distinguish between the average marketing employee and an elite and gifted executive like Ms. Brukovskaya.

headline: Principal Product Manager, ex-Apple | 10+ years in B2C mobile apps: Social, Fitness, Mental Health, HR tech | Podcast host and YouTube Creator | Coach ACC ICF - Boost your career!
location: Austin, Texas, United States of America
summary:
Product Lead with 10 years of experience in consumer mobile apps development for iOS and Android. Launched and improved dozens of products including Apple marketing tools for Gift Cards distribution, Oxygen Health Rx (pharmacies) website for a discounted medication program, a mobile voice messenger Zello (push-to-talk) for emergency response and frontline workers with 150 million users, mobile apps of an Uber ridesharing competitor, and a large social network in Europe of 200M users, developed a new revenue stream through stickers ad virtual gifts which brought 50% of the profit. Founded a coaching  and mentoring program for product managers and other tech professionals which has already helped 1000+ talented people to land their dream job. Host a YouTube channel and podcast for immigrants with over 800,000 views.

Key Product Management achievements include:
- Launched the Oxygen Health Rx website from concept to execution, making affordable healthcare and pharmacy discounts accessible to Americans nationwide
- Launched two Apple corporate web-based tools to track a $10B Apple marketing budget
- Developed a leading audio messenger mobile app called Zello for businesses (SaaS for Transportation, Retail, Manufacturing) and 150 million consumers
- Improved the mobile apps of an Uber competitor, Fasten, which was titled the #1 ridesharing app in Austin (startup)
- Launched a large social network in Europe, Ok.ru, with over 200M users
- Developed a new revenue stream via virtual gifts (stickers), which brought in 50% of the company's profit
- Created two mobile apps from scratch (startups): Memes feed and Sticker wizard

Passioned about following consumers domains: Social, Entertainment, Fitness and Sport, Food and Health, Mental Health, Eating Disorder, Professional Education, HR and Recruiting, Dating, Podcasting, Live Streaming.

In addition to my technical expertise, I also a certified ACC ICF coach and leverage my coaching and leadership skills through mentoring and educating tech professionals, especially immigrants from Eastern Europe, helping them with their product management skills, career development in tech and adjustment to the US culture.

I'm also a marathon runner (my best time is 3:21, Boston qualified), a Cap10K race ambassador, which is the biggest 10k running event in Austin, TX, Girls on the run (GOTR) volunteer, Half marathon pacer, and a member of multiple running communities.

I'm always looking to new opportunities and open to interesting work and projects.

headline: 20+ year experience CMO | EdTech | Media | VOD expert | Marketing Consulting
Principal Software Engineer and Solution Architect at EPAM Systems
location: Leesburg, Virginia, United States of America
summary:
I'm Rauf Aliev, a seasoned Principal Software Engineer and Solution Architect at EPAM Systems. With over 25 years of experience in the IT industry, I've consistently pushed the boundaries of software development and complex systems integration. Here's a glimpse into my journey:

Professional Highlights:

SAP Hybris Expertise: Shortly put, I have an in-depth understanding of SAP Commerce (Hybris), its underlying architecture, including much of its internals. As a certified and experience SAP Hybris developer, I've played a pivotal role in the e-commerce landscape. I've led seven full-cycle SAP Hybris projects and participated in tens (and counting), leaving a mark on the industry.

Knowledge Sharing: I'm an editor and columnist at the largest SAP Commerce blog, hybrismart.com, where I've contributed insights and knowledge to the community. Additionally, I've authored over 200 technical articles on SAP Hybris and e-commerce development.

Trailblazing Leadership: In 2015, I established the first team of Hybris developers in Russia, and delivered first 3 solutions built with it to the market. In 2016 I left the country and moved to the USA.

Diverse Expertise:

Managerial Experience: With 15 years of experience as a project leader, technical/IT manager, and project manager, I understand the intricacies of successful project execution.

Retail and E-commerce: I've dedicated a decade to mastering the complexities of the retail and e-commerce sectors, aligning technology with business objectives.

Technical Proficiency: My technical prowess spans a wide spectrum, from Java development to Python and machine learning.

Project Management: Trained in PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) standards, I excel in project management, business processes, and systems integration.

Versatile Skill Set:

Business Intelligence: I bring a wealth of expertise in business intelligence, reporting, analysis, design, and software development to the table.

Internet Technologies: My current technical skills encompass Internet technologies, security, and e-commerce, allowing me to navigate today's digital landscape.

Beyond the Desk:

Outside of my professional endeavors, I'm a multifaceted individual. I find solace in playing the piano, expressing my creativity through drawing and painting, exploring the world of electronics, and embracing the future through 3D printing.

I'm driven by a passion for innovation, a commitment to excellence, and a thirst for continuous learning.

recommendationHistory.caption: August 5, 2024, Nicholas worked with Rauf on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
I have had the pleasure of working closely with Rauf and I can confidently say he is one of the most skilled and knowledgeable SAP Hybris Architects I have encountered in the industry. Rauf´s in-depth understanding of SAP Hybris and ancillary systems/platforms was truly exceptional.

Rauf consistently demonstrated his ability to support and lead complex implementations, regardless of the scale or ambiguity. HIs expertise spans across the entire project lifecycle—from initial architectural design and integration planning to execution and post-deployment optimisation. Rauf´s technical acumen, coupled with a strategic mindset, ensured that each solution was not only robust and scalable but also aligned with our business objectives.

What really sets Rauf apart is his problem-solving ability. Rauf has a knack for anticipating challenges and developing innovative solutions that keep projects on track and within scope. Whether it’s a multi-channel commerce platform for a global enterprise or a highly customized eCommerce solution for a niche market, Rauf handles it with confidence and precision.

Moreover, Rauf is an excellent communicator and team player. He can explain complex technical concepts in a way that is accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring everyone is on the same page. His collaborative approach fosters a positive working environment and encourages knowledge sharing across the team.

If you are looking for someone who can lead your projects to success, I highly recommend Rauf. His expertise, professionalism, and dedication make him a valuable asset to any organization!

recommendationHistory.description: Rauf's exceptional technical expertise as our Lead Hybris Engineer was instrumental in driving the success of multiple e-commerce initiatives. His honest and direct communication style fostered a collaborative environment, enabling efficient problem-solving and decision-making. Rauf's tireless efforts and dedication to excellence consistently yielded outstanding results, making him an invaluable asset to any team.

headline: AI/ML at scale for startups, VC funds, and forward-thinking enterprises (NVIDIA, ex-Meta, ex-Gigster, PhD from UIUC)
location: San Francisco, California, United States of America
summary:
Hands-on technology leader and PhD with 15+ years of experience applying AI/ML to drive business results as a startup founder, executive, consultant, and advisor. Worked with Fortune 500 corporations and VC-funded startups on AI strategies, products, platforms, and built high-performance AI orgs from zero multiple times. Managed multi-year digital transformation programs and software projects with $10M+ R&D budget and multiple cross-functional and globally distributed teams. Marquee clients: Canon, Dentsu, Vodafone, McDonald’s, GSK, Intel, BillGO, Jibo Robotics.

Now, Nik is the Director of AI Platform at NVIDIA driving MLOps adoption and best practices across the company. In the past, Nik was the co-founder & CEO of Metapixel AI, SaaS company providing AI-powered visual content production for eCommerce. As the Director of AI at Gigster (YC ’S15, A16Z, Redpoint), he managed the full cycle AI practice (technical sales, AI discovery workshops, scoping, team formation, delivery, hand-off), AI platform and methodology development, and strategic AI engagements. Nik also advises startups, provides on-demand high-value consulting services and speaking engagements via his boutique firm (ask in DM).

Nik holds a PhD Degree in Computer Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, summa cum laude Masters in Applied Math and Physics from Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (5.0/5.0 GPA), and is a Google-certified Professional Data Engineer. He publishes and reviews for top academic conferences, like CIKM, KDD, SIGIR, WWW, and gives talks at world-class industry events, like Google Next, Agile Days, Sberbank AI Journey, DataFest, ClickCDO, RIT++, TechWEEK, DSGOX, to name a few.

Nik actively shares his knowledge with the fellow industry practitioners and executives via master classes and workshops at top-50 business schools and corporate training centers. He is the author of “Accelerated Artificial Intelligence Deployment for Digital Leaders” and “AI Product Manager” executive courses produced by Netology. His work was covered by major industry publications and expos, including Google Next 2019, CES2019, CES2020, Digital Imaging Reporter, PetaPixel, Digital Photography Review, Time Magazine, RBC, Expert Magazine, Snob, Rusbase. 

Specialties: Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Search, Recommendations, NLP, Spam Detection, Crowdsourcing, Human-in-the-Loop/Hybrid AI Systems, Cloud AI, Mobile AI, Solution Architecture, Product and Technology Strategy, Data Monetization, Program Management.

Email: spirinus@gmail.com
Cell: +1 (628) 2255166
